content: song song blanket - best of both worlds this blanket was inspired by the widely known sock memory blanket and also uses leftover sock yarns it is made from squares which are joined as they are knitted no seaming necessary the fun twist is that two fingering yarns are used together a commercial sock yarn and a hand dyed sock yarn are held together so you get the best of both worlds the result is stunning - the colors sing their own song as they are play together you can never guess what happens as you knit with them at the same time the fabric is thick yet soft and your blanket will be warm and cozy general notes the blanket is knitted with 5 5 mm needles in garter st knit every row holding two fingering yarns together you are the boss of your blanket so you make the decision about the amount of squares and thus the size of it always work edges of squares as follows slip last st of row purlwise with yarn in front knit first st of row through back loop materials 5 5 mm/us 9 knitting needles if you are a loose knitter i recommend going down one needle size to 5 mm/us 8 fingering sock yarn leftovers of your choice darning needle for weaving in ends removable marker to mark the right side rs and middle st of square if needed st marker instructions first square set up 1 row cast on 63 st 2 row ws k 31 st p 1 k 31 st ws remember to work your edge stitches as described above 1 row rs knit 30 st k centered double decrease slip next 2 st to right needle as if to knit them decrease slip first st from right needle back to left needle k 2 st on left needle decrease then pull first slipped st over knit 30 st 2 row ws k 30 st p 1 k 30 3 row rs k 29 st work centered double decrease k to end 4 row ws k 29 p 1 k 29 continue working like this always putting a centered double decrease in the middle of the rs row and purling that st on the ws use a removable st marker to mark the center in a previous row as needed last row of square rs work the centered double decrease with the remaining 3 st break yarn and pull through on the rs there will be a beautiful line of knit sts running from the bottom right corner to the top left corner of your square second and following squares first row joining sideways all squares are joined to the left of previous square set up 1 row start on upper corner of left edge of previous square pick up and knit 32 st from double loops of edge sts then cast on 31 st with backwards loop method 2 row 31 st p 1 k 31
